isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB SQUARING

svcproc.title: CAB SQUARING
svcproc.para: Cab squaring is the centering and perpendicular positioning of the cab structure to the frame. The cab must be squared whenever the cab has been removed from the chassis for repair, or if a new cab is being mounted.

The cab must be properly squared to the frame as this adjustment will affect the relationship between the cab, hood and sleeper box. Improper squaring may result in unacceptable appearance and interference between the above units. Be sure the chassis is on a level surface before squaring.
Refer to Figure 216 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Center cab (Item 1) on frame rail (Item 4) by using dimension (Item A) a equal distance from cab frame rail to cab cowl (Item 5) on each side.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. EQUAL DIMENSION EACH SIDE OF CAB

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 217 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: There is no adjustment to make cab back panel parallel and perpendicular to the frame. The crossmember mounting plate (Item 1) of cab air suspension system (Item 2) is mounted directly to the chassis crossmember (Item 3) for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models and 7300 and 7400 Crew Cab Models and 7600 and 8600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Models.

The frame mounting brackets (Item 5) of cab air suspension system (Item 6) is mounted directly to right and left frame rail (Item 4) for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005.
